name: Narrator
description: Her voice possesses the warm, steady confidence of a middle-aged British narrator, flowing like well-aged whisky—smooth and assured, with crisp consonants and rounded vowels that guide listeners through tales with elegant, unhurried certainty.

name: Ebenezer Scrooge
description: He speaks with an aged British voice that carries the sharp, grating edge of a man hardened by decades of miserliness, though it can shift unexpectedly from stern and caustic to quavering with penitent emotion—a voice worn thin and reedy by time, capable of both bitter coldness and exuberant joy.
visual_attributes: frosty rime on head and eyebrows

name: Jacob Marley's Ghost
description: He speaks with the hollow, trembling quality of advanced age worn down by eternal suffering, his British accent carrying a haunting resonance that seems to emanate from somewhere far beyond the living world, every syllable weighted with sorrowful warning and spectral desperation.

name: Fred
description: He speaks with the buoyant warmth of a young British gentleman whose optimism bubbles through every syllable, his voice bright and earnest with the kind of infectious cheerfulness that makes even serious matters sound like invitations to celebration.

name: Ghost of Christmas Past
description: His voice flows with an ethereal gentleness, measured and resonant with middle-aged assurance yet touched by something otherworldly—each word delivered in a soft, low British tone that seems to shimmer between the past and present.

name: Ghost of Christmas Present
description: His voice rings out in a rich, commanding British baritone that carries the warmth of a crackling Yuletide fire, shifting from jovial laughter to sorrowful wisdom with the assured fluidity of his middle years, each word imbued with supernatural authority yet touched by genuine emotion.
visual_attributes: green robe bordered with white fur

name: Bob Cratchit
description: He speaks in a soft, hesitant British voice that carries a pleasant but faint quality suggesting a man accustomed to making himself small, yet it brightens with genuine warmth when hope or affection enters his words. His tremulous, apologetic tone occasionally cracks with emotion, revealing the devoted father beneath the timid clerk.

name: Mrs. Cratchit
description: She speaks with a warm, steady British accent grounded in middle-aged maternal strength, though her voice wavers between cheerful determination and anxious concern, occasionally rising with the indignant fire of a mother protecting her own. Her tone carries the measured assurance of one who holds a household together through sheer will and love, even as worry trembles at the edges.

name: Charwoman
description: Her voice is a brazen instrument of working-class British defiance, steady and confident with the hardened quality of a middle-aged woman who has long since abandoned pretense, each word delivered with callous certainty and the occasional bark of cold, mirthless laughter.

name: Charity Collector One
description: His voice is a warm, resonant British baritone marked by middle-aged assurance and unwavering politeness, with a tendency to grow breathless and amazed when discussing charitable works. The steady, measured cadence of his speech reflects both professional experience and earnest conviction, each syllable rounded and pleasant like his genial appearance.

name: Belle
description: She speaks with a soft, gentle British accent that carries the weight of sorrow like rain against windowpanes, yet beneath the trembling grief lies an unmistakable thread of quiet resolve that refuses to break.

name: Old Joe
description: His raspy British voice crackles through the air like dry parchment, gravelly with age and roughened by years of tobacco, yet sharpened by the cunning of a man who's made his living off others' misfortunes. The casual, almost conversational tone masks a calculating mind that weighs every word for profit.

name: Ebenezer Scrooge
description: He delivers his words with the brittle precision of a counting-house master, his British accent hardened by years of avarice into something cold and defensive, each sentence snapped out with the impatience of a man who measures time only in money.

name: Boy in Sunday Clothes
description: The speaker is a youthful, intelligent-sounding presence with a bright British accent that sparkles with eager curiosity, each word delivered with the wondering tone of someone perpetually delighted by the world's possibilities.

name: Fat Businessman
description: He speaks with a steady, prosperous British businessman's drawl, each word delivered with studied indifference as though perpetually stifling a yawn, his mocking tone suggesting he finds the entire world and its concerns beneath his notice.

name: Caroline's Husband
description: He speaks with a weary British accent, his voice carrying the weight of financial strain and fatherly responsibility—each word emerging hesitantly, tinged with embarrassment yet occasionally brightening with fleeting relief, like sunlight breaking through heavy clouds.

name: Scrooge's Niece
description: She speaks with a bright, melodious British voice that carries both youthful warmth and spirited conviction, her tone sweetening with genuine earnestness when defending those she cares about, yet sharpening with playful indignation when injustice is discussed.

name: Master Peter Cratchit
description: He speaks with an eager, youthful British voice that bubbles with pride and barely contained excitement, his words tumbling out with the observant clarity of someone trying hard to prove himself worthy of adult responsibilities.

name: Caroline
description: Her voice carries a gentle British lilt that trembles with maternal anxiety, each word spoken with an eager, faint quality as though she's perpetually catching her breath between gratitude and concern for her children.

name: Mrs. Dilber
description: She speaks with a steady, resonant British working-class accent shaped by years in service, though her words flutter nervously between eager agreeability and self-conscious bursts of laughter that betray her anxious state of mind.

name: Young Cratchits
description: Their voices ring out in shrill, uninhibited British tones—youthful enthusiasm personified—alternating between piercing shrieks of delight and unexpected moments of breathless, statue-like silence.

name: Belle's Husband
description: His voice is resonant and gentle with a British lilt, infused with the unmistakable warmth of a devoted family man whose every syllable seems to embrace those around him with quiet, satisfied joy.

name: Old Fezziwig
description: His voice is a full-bodied British baritone weathered smooth by decades of generous hospitality, spilling forth with oily, comfortable warmth like mulled wine poured from a well-aged cask, every syllable rounded and jovial as if emerging from that capacious waistcoat with a knowing chuckle.

name: First Wealthy Man
description: He possesses a steady, polished British voice that manages to sound both approachable and commanding—the vocal equivalent of an expensive suit worn comfortably, with just enough casual warmth to put others at ease while making it clear who holds the power in any room.

name: Second Wealthy Man
description: He speaks with a sharp, perfunctory British accent characteristic of a middle-aged boardroom veteran who has learned that brevity equals power. Every syllable is measured and curt, delivered with the assured disdain of someone who considers most exchanges an interruption to more important matters.

name: Belle
description: She speaks with a warm, steady British accent that carries the confident assurance of a woman who has raised a family and managed a household, her tone maternal yet composed, with a resonant quality that commands attention without demanding it.

name: Cratchit Daughter
description: Her voice rings with the clear, spirited tone of youthful vitality, carrying a British accent that dances between excited proclamations and affectionate teasing like sunlight flickering through leaves. There's a musical quality to her speech, brimming with the energy and mischief of a young woman finding joy in family moments.

name: Fan
description: She speaks with a bright, lilting British accent that rings out with bell-like clarity, her voice infused with the pristine brightness of early years and brimming with such genuine warmth and enthusiasm that every syllable seems to dance with uncontainable delight.

name: Martha
description: She speaks with a weary but gentle British accent, her youthful voice carrying the dutiful softness of one accustomed to long hours—tired yet tender, like a candle flame struggling to stay bright after burning through the night shift.

name: Plump Sister
aliases: the plump one with the lace tucker
description: Her voice rings with the effervescent quality of a young woman who protests everything with mock indignation before dissolving into genuine, infectious laughter—a British lilt that dances between feigned outrage and delighted amusement.

name: Red-Faced Gentleman
description: He possesses a steady, commanding British voice characteristic of middle-aged tradesmen, though it frequently escalates into blustering exasperation when financial matters are at stake. His tone is thoroughly practical and mercenary, articulating each word with the calculated efficiency of a man who measures conversation by its potential profit.

name: Fred's Servant Girl
description: She speaks with a youthful, clear British accent marked by the courteous formality of her position in service, her voice carrying a soft, melodious quality that conveys both attentiveness and genuine care.

name: Young Ebenezer Scrooge
description: The speaker is a hopeful young man with a clear, affectionate British accent that rings with the earnest optimism of someone still believing in goodness, his words tumbling out with the eager sincerity of uncrushed youth.

name: Second Businessman
description: His voice has the warm, measured quality of a seasoned British merchant, middle-aged and assured, with an inquiring lilt that makes even simple statements sound like friendly questions. The casual cadence flows like a shopkeeper making pleasant conversation, confident but never stiff.

name: Third Businessman
description: His voice carries the warm, grounded quality of a middle-aged British tradesman, balanced between the easy informality of a man comfortable in his station and sudden bursts of astonishment that punctuate his speech like exclamation points—resonant and assured, yet animated by an endearing readiness to be caught off-guard.

name: Carol Singer
aliases: owner of one scant young nose
description: He speaks with a youthful British accent that alternates between sweet, tentative singing and nervous, breathy speech, his voice quivering with cold and trepidation like a candle flame struggling against an icy wind.

name: Charity Collector Two
description: He speaks with warm, rounded tones characteristic of a middle-aged British gentleman, each word delivered with diplomatic politeness yet undergirded by an observant shrewdness and a persistence as soft as velvet but as unyielding as steel.

name: The Schoolmaster
description: He speaks in a terrible, resonant British baritone that carries the weight of absolute authority—steady and commanding, yet laced with such withering condescension that every utterance feels like a masterclass in disdain. His ferocious delivery is all the more chilling for its measured control, each word a calculated strike.

name: Tiny Tim
description: He speaks with a plaintive, feeble British voice that quivers like a candle flame in winter wind, each thoughtful word emerging with gentle effort yet carrying an earnest sincerity and quiet grace that transforms frailty into something luminous.

name: Topper
description: The speaker is a young man with a remarkably deep bass voice that carries the rich, rolling tones of a British accent, his vocal quality possessing both the vibrancy of youth and the impressive depth of a trained musician who can drop into a resonant growl.
